The first thing that would happen is the complete transformation of the marine ecosystem, as fish and other aquatic creatures would no longer be able to survive in freshwater.
The second thing that would happen is the increase in the population of freshwater creatures, as more water would be available for them to thrive in.
The third thing that would happen is the change in the temperature of the water, as freshwater tends to be cooler than saltwater.
The fourth thing that would happen is the change in the salinity of the water, as freshwater has a much lower salinity than saltwater.
The fifth thing that would happen is the change in the water density, as freshwater is less dense than saltwater.
